title: Binning Wood Walking Route

images.title: Calum McRoberts / Binning Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Binning Wood. Many nature trails have been created through Binning Wood. This sign warns that "ALL" dogs must be kept on the lead due to wildlife conservation work.

images.title: Sandy Gemmill / Pathway into Binning Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pathway into the wood. The view from the gate at the main road of one of the pathways into Binning Wood.

images.title: Richard Webb / Orienteering in Binning Wood., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Orienteering in Binning Wood. Binning is one of the few large woodlands in East Lothian. An example of recreational use.

images.title: Richard Webb / Edge of Binning Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Edge of Binning Wood. The unseen Peffer Burn divides Binning Wood from farmland.

images.title: Richard Webb / Clearing in Binning Wood, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Clearing in Binning Wood. The wood is famed for its clearings with radiating rides. Based on French hunting forests.

images.title: james denham [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Road running between the Oak and Bining Woods

description: These peaceful woods in East Lothian have some nice trails and good bird watching opportunities. Look out for Jays, Great Spotted Woodpeckers and Nuthatches on your walk. You may also see otters in the pond or the pretty burn that runs through the woods. Other features include a number of lovely circular clearings and several small car parks around the perimeter. The site is located close to John Muir Country Park which is a great place to extend your walk. In the park there's lovely beaches and a wide variety of plantlife and birdlife to look out for.
